page.title: 12THE ELDERLY IN CHESTERTON
page.content: Elm Grove is a private residential home for the care of the elderly 1.3km SE of Cirencester.It has been extended until it now has 27 bedrooms.These are fitted with an intercom system so that in cases of emergancy the residents can be in instant touch with the State Registered nursing and other members of the home's 40 staff.Lifts,baths and toilets are designed for use by those residents who are wheel-chair bound. There are hand rails to aid movement in all the corridors and the building is kept very warm as the elderly feel the cold.There are communal rooms such as a T.V room,Laundrette and Dining Hall as well as the resident's own bed sitting rooms.Occupational therepists from the local hospital give treatment and arrange outings for the residents. As many people retire to this area Elm Grove will soon need to be extended.
